name: Shelburne Country Inn

reviews.title: Wonderful food
reviews.text: I only came here for dinner which was wonderful. I toured the Inn and it is as advertised, a beautiful, renovated old house with antique furnishings. In two words quite lovely. The dinner was excellent, incredibly fresh and perfectly cooked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in mid-September. The room was nice (country stylish) and it came with a fabulous breakfast the next morning that more than warranted the room charge. They have hot coffee and tea available all the time in the lobby and even had ceramic mugs/cups and hottles you could take to your room. The lavender soap in the room's bathroom was so nice we used it through the rest of our trip. The staff was very friendly and everything was very casual. There is a great restaurant in the inn and it looked like its meal would be fabulous as well. We'd go back in a heartbeat but would be sure to give ourselves more time there next time.
reviews.title: We stayed here in mid-September. The room...

reviews.text: We recently stayed to have our wedding on the beach and our reception at the Shelburne Inn. Laurie and David and their staff made our day special. They made every guest feel at home and special. They truly helped to make this the most perfect day of our lives. Everything went perfect and they where a big part of making it happen. The staff was very caring and catered to our needs and request. We both feel we picked the perfect place to have our entire wedding party and guest stay. We also had the reception their and they where ready to do the wedding there if the weather did not hold up. We will go back time and time again to stay. They made everyone feel welcome.
reviews.title: Excellent servic e

reviews.title: Very nice visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A classic hotel/B&B. Great restaurant along with a gourmet breakfast. A lively pub in the evening. The staff is perfect.
reviews.title: Big disappointment! Cramped, noisy, poor ventilation! Stay away!
One of our favorites on the Peninsula
reviews.text: We try to get to the Shelburne Pub for lunch when we are at the beach, because of the innovative preparation and attentive details. When was your ice water contained lemon & dill? I had the tried & true pan fried oysters while my wife had the jalapeño burger, which she loved. All the food is wonderful.

It was an off-time and I said we only wanted tea but they were very accommodating. It was a sunny day and we greatly enjoyed sitting on the patio and walking through their lovely garden. Very interesting to see the beautiful woodwork and stained glass inside. They have a handsome bar adjoining the patio and decent bar menu. I'm sure that would be a great option another time.
reviews.title: Lovely tea on patio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I had the pleasure of recently staying at the Shelburne Inn, in Seaview, Washington, and had an absolutely wonderful time. The Inn itself is nicely decorated and evokes a kind of simple, rustic, charm that is both immediately inviting, and entirely calming. The room we stayed in was similar in decor and was rather large, with a very comfortable large bed in it.
reviews.title: Charming Bed and Breakfast by the Sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay included one dinner and some two breakfasts, and all of the meals were fantastic. The first night we dined on some excellently cooked steak and a chocolate lava cake, and were not disappointed at all. The breakfasts consisted of wide variety of choices, but we settled on omelets and scrambles which were tasty and presented nicely.
reviews.title: Relaxing and peaceful!

reviews.text: The staff at both the Inn and the restaurant were very friendly and welcoming, and we managed to strike up quite a few conversations with David, who is one of the owners of the Shelburne. Every other staff member we met was friendly and helpful and seemed to love to talk about the area and to get to find out where my girlfriend and I were from.
reviews.title: A lovely experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on other reviews, maybe an off night? My wife and I live on the Pennisula and wanted to try something different from the several wonderful restaurants from Illwaco to Ocean Park. The menu was interesting but was disappointed to learn there were no Chef specials. The brandied wild mushroom appetizer was nicely seasoned and not overcooked. The waiter was dropping his rehearsed one liners in the middle of conversation.Not cool. Or funny. My wife chose the crab cakes and I their substitute for ciapino. The crab cakes were dry and crabless and my seafood stew was so hot I could barely make out the seasonings. Not that we wanted to-go bags for our meals but he never asked. He never questioned the large left overs. After receiving the check her asked how I liked the stew? I told him it was far too hot for me and I love hot food. He defended the Chef's claim to 2 teaspoons of chipoltle chile to 5 gallons of stew. We left dissapointed because we expected more from a place like this. I will say the decore and surroundings are beautiful. It was an experience worth trying. We did.
reviews.title: Our Dinner Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped in for a drink and some lunch. We have a beach house so we didn't need the room. The bar tender was very helpful and knowledgable. The food was good. We really enjoyed the atmospher.
reviews.title: didn't stay here but stopped in for a drink.

reviews.text: A brief word on how I rate a hotel. I don’t compare the hotels I stay in with the uber deluxe such as the Ritz Carltons, Westins, Marriotts and Hiltons. I look for value (price), location, comfort (a bed that easily holds my 6 foot, 1 inch body), en suite facilities, free or inexpensive breakfast, room for our suitcases (and us) and great people staffing the hotel. A five star hotel exceeds my expectations. A four star hotel meets my expectations.
reviews.title: Escape to the past

reviews.text: I have been visiting the Shelburne Inn ever since Laurie & David bought the place 30 or so years ago. When I first starting going to the Shelburne, there were no locks on the room doors and many rooms had the bath "down the hall". We recently treated our family to a stay on our 40th Anniversary on a long December weekend around Christmas. We took over most of the China Beach Retreat plus a couple of rooms in the main B&B a couple of miles away. The rooms were excellent with no TV, no telephones, no radios although there was a TV at China Beach. The breakfast, included with the rooms, was unbelievably good & extraordinarily filling - WORLD CLASS at least. Dinners at the Shoalwater Restaurant were gourmet beyond belief. Who cares about WiFi? We go there to GET AWAY not to hook up. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The antique furnishings are just right. Laurie & David are great hosts with an encyclopedic of things to do, to see and to eat in the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful Historic Inn stones throw from Pacific Ocean

reviews.text: As previous reviews have noted I am not a big fan of old hotels and B and B's but this historic Inn was a fabulous place to stay during a recent two day business trip to the Long Beach area along with Pacific Ocean in Washington State. The rooms were large and clean and mine came with a private outdoor patio area that was really a nice feature. No TV's or radios (this is a good thing) but a lovely lobby, complimentary coffee and tea and on one afternoon a local ladies weaving club was in the lobby spinning away. The room comes with breakfast and my oyster mushroom omelet was out of this world. The location is good, with shops and restaurants nearby, and one of the greatest beaches in the World about three blocks away. I did not eat dinner in the restaurant but joined friends in the Pub one night and the entrees they were served looked fabulous. This is a great Inn and the staff were super nice and I had a chance to meet the owner who told me he'd been there "forever".
reviews.title: A cozy charming home away from home!

reviews.text: This is like staying at a dear friend's home. Cozy, charming, and inviting. Comfortable bedding, amenities, cookies in the room & coffee & tea in the fabulous "lobby" which is a wonderful place to just sit and chat, read, or play board games. Each room has large private bath. Wifi is free. Complimentary gourmet breakfast is amazing!!
reviews.title: Delightfully charming!

reviews.text: Owners David & Laurie make you feel like personal friends you'll want to visit again and again. This is our 5th stay.
reviews.title: like going back in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about as quirky as anything I have stayed in. It reminded me of 221 Baker Street or an old London house. The place is full of antiques is a gem if you like to revisit history. The hotel itself was very good, the bed was comfortable and the services just right. The restaurant was the best meal we had in Washington State and is highly recommended.. A delightful old inn
reviews.title: Cozy hotel on the Long Beach Peninsula

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I wanted to get away from the Halloween frenzy on our short city street. Sixteen years ago, we had had a memorable dinner at the Showalter Restaurant in Seaview, contained in the Shelburne Inn at that time. We decided to go back to Seaview, stay at the Shelburne Inn, and eat in their restaurant, probably under other management, but still said to be excellent. We made a reservation, but we were informed that the restaurant would be closed on Monday. The hotel is charming, and we had the feeling that the staff would bend over backwards if they could to make us comfortable. Homemade cookies, offers to bring tea to our room, etc. We didn't have any demands. The rooms are small, attractively decorated, and furnished with antiques from a couple of generations ago (four-poster canopied beds, fringed lamp shades, etc.). No telephone or television in the rooms, but there is free WiFi and a computer with high-speed internet for the use of guests in the small library. There are books in all the rooms, and in the library. If you have mobility problems (are wheelchair bound, or need a walker or a cane), this may not be the place for you, since the rooms are up a flight of stairs, and there is no elevator. The breakfast was quite good. I'm sorry we missed having dinner there.
reviews.title: It Keeps Calling Us Back...

reviews.text: if your refined, educated, well-traveled, and enjoy the finer things in life, you wont be dissappionted with your stay at the Shelburne.Over many years since the 1980's, we have always returned to this charming Inn.Having lived all over the country we always managed to come back, if only for a weekend. Once again last week, we left our beach area home in Southern California for the rainy quiet town on the Long Beach Peninsula. And once again we returned refreshed in mind and body, although a few pounds heavier. We were lucky enough to have come at a time when the Inn was hosting their Annual Mushroom and Beer dinner. Having traveled the world for both business and pleasure, wed like to tell you, you'd be hard pressed to find a more special meal and place....and of course the people. the very special Innkeepers, David and Laurie, the brilliant and charming Beer brewers Charles and Rosanne, who hosted from The Pike Brewery in Seattle, to the 2 young talented chefs, it was perfection.
reviews.title: Great Escape from the 21st Century

description: Located just a 10-minutes walk from the Pacific seacoast and established in 1896, the Shelburne Inn is the oldest continuously operating hotel in the State of WA. Period antique American and European furnishings lend authenticity to the decor, which is accented by the work of regional artists. Complimentary gourmet breakfasts are served in the elegant Shelburne Restaurant dining room for guests of the inn. Also open to the public, the Shelburne Restaurant & Pub offer an award-winning wine list and feature micro-brewed beer on tap. The cuisine is based upon the fresh, seasonal bounty of the region. The Shelburne Inn offers modern amenities such as free Wi-Fi and computer library. Freshly baked cookies upon arrival, all-day coffee and tea service and designer toiletries complete the amenity package for inn guests. All rooms have private bath and many have an exterior deck or balcony. The Shelburne Inn is an ideal location for weddings, reunions, group retreats and business meetings, as well as for a romantic getaway for two.
